bdi4jade.belief

Class AbstractBelief<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • bdi4jade.core.MetadataElementImpl
      • bdi4jade.belief.AbstractBelief<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the belief value.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Belief<T>, MetadataElement, jade.content.Concept, jade.content.Term, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractBeliefSet, PersistentBelief, TransientBelief

    public abstract class AbstractBelief<T>
extends MetadataElementImpl
implements Belief<T>
    This is an abstract class that implements the Belief interface. It implements some of the interface methods, leaving some implementations to the subclasses, mainly the choice of how the belief value is stored. It is class observable by belief bases (BeliefBase), allowing the observation on changes in the value of this belief.
    Author:
    Ingrid Nunes
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • removeBeliefBase

        public void removeBeliefBase(BeliefBase beliefBases)
        Description copied from interface: Belief
        Removes a belief base that does not contain this belief anymore. The agent whose capability does not contain this belief in the belief base does not believe in this belief anymore.
        Specified by:

      • setName

        protected void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of this belief. Ideally, a belief name should be final and initialized in the constructor. This method should be only used if persistence frameworks are used.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to set.
